Description: A New York-based hedge fund manager, Och-Ziff Capital Management Group LLC, and its wholly-owned subsidiary, OZ Africa Management GP LLC, resolved criminal charges and agreed to pay a criminal penalty of more than $213 million in connection with a widespread scheme involving the bribery of officials in the Democratic Republic of Congo and Libya.

OZ Management LP settled allegations that it provided inaccurate trade data to four prime brokers, causing inaccuracies in the brokers' books and records and in data provided to the SEC in investigations.  OZ Management, an investment adviser for numerous Och-Ziff funds, admitted wrongdoing and agreed to pay a $4.25 million penalty.
